result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca J. Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 16CT34, 15CF413, 15CM409 called together at 3:10pm [mo]
Defendant Rebecca J Evans in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Evans. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "NO CONTEST  " entered on Cases 15CM409 & 15CF413; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 16CT34
The Court dismisses uncharged DA Case# 15JE652 DOV: 3/13/15 Charge: Possess Illegally Obtained Rx Drug

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Evans

On Case 15CM409, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1year.

On Case 15CF413, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years.

The Court adopts the conditions as set forth in the criminal case settlement:

[which are:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per Agent
--assessment within 60 days of disposition
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or  counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--undergo any assessment, treatment or therapies as directed by DOC
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession of a contolled substance without a valid prescription
--submit to random drug screening at the discretion of the DOC
--no contact with any known drug offenders, except for treatment purposes or as otherwise approved by DOC
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay statutory costs]


The Court determines that Ms. Evans has already submitted DNA, does not order another sample to be taken
Days credit for time already served:  1 days
 as to 15CM409, 0 days at to 15CF413

recess: 3:44pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch III:  
[MK] cases #15CM409 and #15CF413 called at 8:56am.
Defendant Rebecca J Evans in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.  
Arraignment is held in Case #15CF413:
---Service of Information admitted; reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
---Plea of "Not Guilty" entered 
On request of Attorney Hagemann the Court schedules both cases for change of plea and sentencing. 
recess 8:50am.

NEXT: Plea & Sentencing hearing on 6/28/16 at 10:30am- send notices
Status conference on April 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Cases 15CF413  called  at 1:11pm [mo]
Defendant Rebecca J. Evans in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CF413:
Ms. Evans waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

The State requests an arraignment be scheduled.

Upon inquiry of the Clerk, Parties agree that 15CM409 can track with 15CF413 as a status conference 
recess: 1:15pm

NEXT:   Arraignment (15CF413)/ Status Conference (15CM409) on 4/11/16 at 9:00am
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Continuance of the 3/23/16 plea and sentencing

Cases 15CF413 and 15CM409 called together at 2:26pm [mo]
Defendant Rebecca J. Evans does not appear in court
Attorney Whitney Hagemann appears in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 15CM409:
The Court reviews the Court Record
The Court finds probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint

Ms. Evans appears at 2:30pm 

As to Case 15CF413, Initial Appearance occurs:
The Court verifies date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
 Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Evans. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--No Contact with Heather Hemenway, other than appearing at group and having contact with Ms. Hemenway at group
--booking at JESO today
recess: 2:37pm 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/16/16 at 9:40am  (2) Status Conference on  5/3/16 at 10:00am

Case called at 10:45am [mo]
Attorney Whitney Hagemann in court.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Rebecca Evans does NOT appear in court.

The Court informs all parties that the Court was aprised by the Court's baliff that Ms. Evans had been in a traffic incident and it was unknown if Ms. Evans would be able to continue her travel to the Courthouse
The Court adjourns this case until 2/12/16 at 2:00pm when Ms. Evans has an initial appearnce on another case
recess: 10:48am

NEXT: Status Conference on 2/12/16 at 2:00pm
Defendant appeared in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD

[MK] case called at 1:24pm. 
Defendant Rebecca J. Evans appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Ms. Evans provides her address on 9th Street in Watertown and she verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court reinstates the $500 Cash Bond, with added conditions:
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Melanie Perales or with Alexander Mendoza
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
recess 1:28pm. 


NEXT: (1) remove Bail Forfeiture Hearing from the Court's calendar (2) Pretrial Conference on 12/2/15 at 2:20pm   (3) Status Conference on 1/12/16 at 8:30am
